description: At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc. , Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots.

raw.title: Field Service Engineer (UR & MiR, Nevada, Remote) (Reno, NV, US)
raw.excerpt: At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc. , Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots.
raw.description:
At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. And as the market leader with 75,000+ collaborative robots (cobots) already installed worldwide, we‚Äôre well on the way to achieving it. We employ 1000+ people in offices across North America, South America, Europe and Asia and we‚Äôre growing all the time. Our team is made up smart, creative people working at the forefront of automation. Together we find innovative solutions to some of the most important manufacturing issues facing businesses today. We dare to do what others find impossible- working with advanced technologies to change in the way businesses operate, So if you‚Äôre looking to build your career with a ground-breaking technology company in dynamic environment with career advancement UR is the place for you.

Our Purpose:

TERADYNE, where experience meets innovation and driving excellence in every connection. We are fueled by creativity and diversity of thought and in our workforce. Our employees are supported to innovate and learn something new every day.

We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team ‚Äì one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Opportunity Overview:

As a Robotics Field Service Engineer, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality technical support for Universal Robots (UR) and Mobile Industrial Robots (MiR) systems. This role involves troubleshooting, repair, preventative maintenance, and customer training across North America. You will serve as a key technical resource, ensuring optimal system performance and customer satisfaction while identifying opportunities for continuous improvement and innovation.

This is a customer-facing role requiring self-management, strong problem-solving skills, and extensive travel. You will collaborate with internal teams, distributors, and end-users to resolve complex issues and contribute to product development feedback.

  • Technical Support: Provide remote and on-site troubleshooting, diagnostics, and repair services for robotic systems and components.
  • Preventative Maintenance: Perform scheduled maintenance to minimize downtime and extend system life.
  • Documentation & Reporting: Maintain accurate service records, case documentation, warranty claims, and CRM updates.
  • Customer Training: Deliver hands-on training and coaching to customers and internal teams on system operation, maintenance, and safety.
  • Product Feedback: Act as the voice of the customer by providing feedback to engineering and product teams regarding system performance, deficiencies, and desired enhancements.
  • Inventory Management: Maintain service tools, spare parts, and test equipment inventory.
  • Sales & Support Collaboration: Identify upsell opportunities during service visits and support sales teams with technical insights.
  • Trade Show & Demo Support: Maintain demo units and support technical setup for exhibitions and customer demos.
  • Mentor junior technicians and collaborate with cross[1]functional teams to improve service delivery.

All About You:

We seek individuals who share our passion and determination. Our commitment to customer success drives us to go the extra mile. If you‚Äôre ready to join us in this mission, take a closer look at the minimum criteria for the position.

  • Associate‚Äôs or Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Mechatronics, Robotics, or a related technical field.
  • Technical certifications in robotics or automation are a plus.
  • Equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of formal education.
  • 3+ years in field service, robotics, automation, or electro-mechanical systems (Experience with 6- axis robots and AMRs preferred).
  • Strong mechanical and electrical troubleshooting skills.
  • Ability to read and interpret electrical schematics and control diagrams.
  • Familiarity with PLCs, sensors, actuators, and industrial networking.
  • Programming experience (C++, Python, Java) is a plus.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong customer service orientation.
  • Ability to work effectively both under minimal supervision and collaboratively within a team.
  • Proactive, curious, and solution-oriented mindset.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds.
  • Valid driver‚Äôs license with a clean driving record.
  • Must be located within 90 minutes of a major airport.
  • Willingness to travel up to 80% domestically and internationally.

Compensation:

The base salary range for this role is $66,200-$106,000. This range is a good faith estimate, and the amount of base salary will correspond with experience and skill set. This range can also fluctuate depending on demand and location.

Incentive Plan: This job is eligible for discretionary bonus(es) based on financial performance.

Benefits:

Teradyne offers a variety of robust health and well-being benefit programs, including medical, dental, vision, Flexible Spending Accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance, paid vacation & holidays, tuition assistance programs, and more. Please click here to see details.

raw.description:
We're a software startup looking for a ‚Äòuber‚Äô* full stack developer. Essentially, ‚Äòuber developer' is a jack of all trades who can do a little bit of everything. In addition to being a developer, this person is also a software architect and can help with some high level software design decisions. We also need the uber developer to do code review, provide some technical guidance to the junior developers, to help do some mentoring, support, and maybe a bit of training.

Ideally, you know C# and React both really well. You must know one of the two really, really well.

*The 'uber' full stack developer position is not related to or connected to the company Uber in any way.

The monthly fee is the budget: $2100.

Strong English and being a strong communicator is a must.

MS stack qualifications

‚Ä¢ Web developer to create a SaaS workflow automation platform

‚Ä¢ Fluent in .Net web languages and frameworks
o C#
o HTML5, CSS
o JavaScript
o Bootstrap
o ORM (Entity Framework, LINQ)
o Nice to have (WebAPI, SignalR, .Net Core)

‚Ä¢ Fluent in database systems, technologies
o Postgres SQL
o T-SQL
o MS SQL Server
o Nice to have (document database experience i.e. Cosmos DB)

‚Ä¢ Other
o GIT familiarity
o Strong work ethic
o A "can do" attitude, flexibility of schedule, plus willingness and ability to work with a remote team that covers 4 different time zones

‚Ä¢ Nice to have outside the above

o Cloud (Google, AWS, Azure)
o Mobile experience
o Frontend frameworks such as React

Submit the following:
o Resume
o Git profile

o Links to your projects

  1. Are you able to work the hours of Mon-Fri, 9 AM to 6 PM, Eastern Standard Time?
  2. Are you able and willing to work outside of traditional local hours, if need be?
  3. What is your level of English proficiency? What is your level of English proficiency in the CEFR scale or equivalent?

Treehouse Strategy is a management consulting company that specializes in helping language companies around the world grow and get to the next level. We work with language companies on sales strategies, marketing plans, marketing initiatives execution (rebranding strategy, website redesign, social media management, SEO, etc.), technology advisory, and merger & acquisition advisory and brokerage. We have clients in Greece, France, UK, Argentina, Spain, the US, and Taiwan.

raw.title: External Sales Contractor
raw.excerpt: The primary objective of a 1099 contracted agent is to generate new business, manage client renewals annually, and provide ongoing service to members.
raw.description:
The primary objective of a 1099 contracted agent is to generate new business, manage client renewals annually, and provide ongoing service to members. As a licensed 215 agent, you will build a book of business under Florida Blue exclusively, focusing on ACA (Under 65) and Medicare (Over 65) segments. This is an outside sales position requiring proactive outreach and full-cycle sales execution.

Agents may opt in to Apple‚Äôs year-round lead distribution system. Participation requires a mutually agreed-upon production schedule. This role is ideal for agents who are adaptable, proactive, and focused on long-term client relationships.

Core Responsibilities

  • Maintain a current Florida 215 Health License and active Florida Blue appointment
  • Complete all mandatory training, certifications, and carrier onboarding
  • Sell Florida Blue products through compliant sales processes: face-to-face, phone, and electronic
  • Guide prospects through the entire sales process from lead to close
  • Manage book of business through renewals, service, and retention efforts
  • Address and resolve policy delinquencies and member account issues
  • Engage in age-in, age-out, and life event transitions with professionalism and accuracy
  • Analyze member needs and conduct product comparisons using carrier-approved tools
  • Present plan options clearly, explaining benefits and value-added services
  • Educate clients on Florida Blue‚Äôs self-service platforms and enrollment resources
  • Cross-sell eligible products (e.g., dental, vision, income protection) to maximize client value

Professional Expectations

  • Adhere to Florida Blue and CMS marketing and compliance standards
  • Demonstrate high ethical standards in sales practices and member interactions
  • Follow up on leads in a timely and professional manner
  • Remain up-to-date with industry and product changes
  • Be responsive to administrative and support team requests
  • Represent Apple Insurance and Florida Blue in a professional manner at community or marketing events when applicable
  • Holds a Florida 215 Health License
  • Previous Health Insurance Sales Experience

Work Environment

  • Location: Join us at our vibrant office in Boca Raton, Florida.
  • Schedule: Full-time role with flexibility for evening or weekend shifts, especially during open enrollment seasons.
  • Tools: Equipped with state-of-the-art call center software, CRM systems, and access to Florida Blue‚Äôs comprehensive product resources and training.

Sometimes in life, you find yourself in the right place, at the right time, looking at an opportunity so extraordinary it cannot be ignored. We celebrate both individual successes and collective accomplishments, making sure the industry recognizes the remarkable company we‚Äôre building together, as well as the impact we‚Äôre having on our clients and communities. Ranked as one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S. for three consecutive years, we have more than 5,000 team members across 200 offices across the country, who actively, genuinely care about our clients, each other and the quality of our work, and in every interaction, represent a company that people want to work for and do business with.

We are looking for engineers with practical development experience and drive.

  • Work on a wide array of projects, from strategy and architecture engagements to a full life-cycle development, systems integration, performance tuning, training and mentoring.

  • Comfort with one or more application development frameworks: Spring, Express or HAPI, Django or Flask, etc.

  • Bonus points for having Go, Clojure, Scala, Apache Spark, Hadoop, Stream Processing, Mobile technologies: iOS (Swift/Objective-C), and Android (Kotlin/Java) native applications.

  • Bonus points for being involved in the Tech community (i.e. run user group, tech meetings, posts on social media).

  • Excellent problem-solving, communication and analytical skills.

Benefits

  • 401K retirement plan.

  • Flexible spending account.

Chariot Solutions has 18+ years of experience solving challenging business problems with technology and is a top IT consulting firm specializing in software, mobile, cloud and data pipeline engineering. Chariot Solutions Specializes in:

title: Freelance Medical Interpreter
description: OverviewSOSi is actively seeking qualified, professional, and experienced medical interpreters.

raw.title: Freelance Medical Interpreter
raw.excerpt: OverviewSOSi is actively seeking qualified, professional, and experienced medical interpreters.
raw.description:
Overview

SOSi is actively seeking qualified, professional, and experienced medical interpreters. Our job is to provide in person, over the phone, and video remote interpretation (VRI) interpretation services for scheduled and on-demand service requests within the state of Washington, and bordering zip codes. The government contractor requires interpretation services for injured workers and crime victims during medical and vocational appointments. All languages are encouraged to apply across the country.

Essential Job Duties

  • Provides scheduled and on-demand in-person, over-the-phone, and VRI consecutive interpretation between Multiple Languages and English and vice versa between medical/vocational providers and injured workers and crime victims with low English proficiency as required.

Minimum Requirements

  • High School Diploma.
  • Ability to obtain and provide a valid driver's license, U.S. passport or other government issued photo ID.
  • Ability to obtain a background check through Washington Access To Criminal History (WATCH) website.
  • Highly proficient in both English and Target Language, ILR scale of 2+.
  • Ability to speak English and Target Language fluently, including high to low levels of language register, regional colloquialisms, and slang expressions, and do so with clear and intelligible pronunciation.
  • Ability to preserve the tone and emotional level of the speaker, as well as manage the delivery, speed, and length of the statement (projection, pace and pausing) of the speaker.
  • Ability to maintain appropriate speed and projection while rendering interpretation, and request and incorporate clarification of speaker‚Äôs statements only when justified.
  • Ability to obtain one of the following certifications:
    • Washington State Department of Social and Health Services
    • Federal Court Interpreter Certification Examination
    • Washington State Administrative Office for the Courts
    • National Board of Certification for Medical Interpreter
    • Certification Commission for Healthcare Interpreters (CCHI)
    • US State Department Office of Language Services
  • Ability to obtain a National Provider Identifier (NPI) Number
  • Ability to obtain a Unified Business Identifier (UBI) with the Washington State Department of Revenue.

Work Environment

  • In-person appointments throughout the state of Washington and surrounding zip codes.
  • Remote work available for telephonic and video remote appointments.

Working at SOSi

All interested individuals will receive consideration and will not be discriminated against for any reason.

Founded in 1989, SOSi is among the largest private, founder-owned technology and services integrators in the defense and government services industry. We deliver tailored solutions, tested leadership, and trusted results to enable national security missions worldwide.

title: 1099 Provider (APRN/PA)
description: OverviewGroups is a leading outpatient provider specializing in substance use disorder (SUD) treatment.

raw.title: 1099 Provider (APRN/PA)
raw.excerpt: OverviewGroups is a leading outpatient provider specializing in substance use disorder (SUD) treatment.
raw.description:
Overview

Groups is a leading outpatient provider specializing in substance use disorder (SUD) treatment. We are committed to supporting underserved communities hit hardest by the opioid crisis. Since 2014, our local care teams have guided hundreds of thousands of individuals on their path to recovery, helping them reclaim their purpose and dignity through compassionate, collaborative care. Our evidence-based approach combines medication, group therapy, and personalized support, delivered online and in person by local providers. Founded on the belief that recovery extends beyond the traditional office visit, Groups helps members build a foundation for long-term recovery and the fulfilling lives they want and deserve.

Together with our community partners, public agencies, and health plans, we are raising the bar in addiction health care‚Äîand we‚Äôre just getting started.

Groups is changing lives. Join us.

Responsibilities

Nurse Practitioner/ Advance Practice Nurse (1099):

  • Assist in conducting intakes. Providers see patients after they have already undergone an extensive evaluation by the counselor.
  • Monitor patients' clinical progress at regular group counseling sessions. Groups are run by specialized counseling staff; providers participate by answering questions and managing patients‚Äô medication dosing.
  • Authorize patients' prescriptions during monthly visits with patient panels.
  • Complete all notes and reporting in Groups EMR system within required timeline (providers receive full orientation/ training on Clinical Protocols before eligible to begin work with Groups)

*We utilize strict protocols to guide clinical decision-making. We have also developed a unique, technology-driven and team-based clinical system that handles all day-to-day patient management and regulatory compliance. This allows physicians to focus exclusively on medical management.

Qualifications

Nurse Practitioner/ Advance Practice Nurse (1099) Requirements:

  • Active, Unencumbered State License (NP/APRN) in the State in which you are applying.
  • Active, Individual DEA with address listed in the State in which you are applying (please note that if you intend on prescribing in multiple states, a separate DEA is required in each state in which you are planning on prescribing).
  • DEAX designation as formerly required to prescribe Buprenorphine *or* proof of 8hrs of qualified training as assigned by SAMHSA will be required.
  • 1 yr. Minimum Actively Prescribing Buprenorphine
  • Proof of Active Board Certification
  • Ability to work in-office at least 5hrs per week.
  • Eligibility for hours will commence approximately 3 months after initiation of the credentialing process.

title: Director, Product Management

raw.title: Director, Product Management
raw.excerpt: Become a part of our caring community and help us put health first The Director, Product Management Conceives of, develops, delivers, and manages products for customer use.
raw.description:
Become a part of our caring community and help us put health first

The Director, Product Management Conceives of, develops, delivers, and manages products for customer use. The Director, Product Management requires an in-depth understanding of how organization capabilities interrelate across the function or segment.

The Director, Product Management is responsible for the strategic direction, execution, and performance of a diverse product portfolio, overseeing all stages of the product life cycle‚Äîfrom concept through market introduction and ongoing optimization. This leader develops products tailored to evolving customer and business needs, ensures alignment with organizational strategy, and drives achievement of cost and success metrics. The Director partners closely with executive leadership and cross-functional stakeholders to deliver innovative, high-impact solutions.


Use your skills to make an impact

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee strategy, development, and management of more than 50 products across domains such as Benefits & Eligibility, Drug Pricing, Clinical Programs, Medication Data, Formulary, and Networks.
  • Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team of product managers, fostering a culture of accountability, strategic alignment, and continuous improvement.
  • Drive product roadmaps and backlogs, ensuring alignment with enterprise and business priorities by collaborating across product lines and engaging directly with stakeholders.
  • Facilitate ongoing structured conversations with business, IT, and leadership to refine and validate product and portfolio priorities.
  • Make strategic decisions regarding new or updated products and programs, resource allocation, and implementation approaches.
  • Oversee integration and relationship management with key partners
  • Establish and evolve best practices in product management, supporting both technical and operational procedures.
  • Monitor product performance post-launch, leveraging customer and partner feedback to guide ongoing optimization and ensure continued alignment with organizational goals.
  • Lead process improvement initiatives within the product delivery lifecycle and associated systems.
  • Support prioritization of initiatives within the approved technology budget.
  • Serve as a key advisor to senior leadership, providing enterprise-wide communications and collaboration to ensure product decisions support strategic objectives.
  • Build strong relationships across the organization to drive cross-functional collaboration and influence at all levels.
  • Effectively forecast and manage to operational and technology budgets

Required Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience.
  • Minimum 8 years of Product Management experience
  • Minimum 5 years of management experience.
  • Minimum of 3 years of pharmacy or PBM experience.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and executing product strategy.
  • Proven ability to lead and mentor diverse teams of product managers.
  • Experience in establishing new product organizations and developing ways of working.
  • Familiarity with the software development life cycle.
  • Experience with product management tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, Jira, Lucid).
  • Ability to manage multiple complex projects and deadlines, and work effectively with senior leadership.
  • Strong communication, stakeholder management, and influencing skills.
  • Flexible, dynamic, and passionate about improving consumer experiences

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Evidence of leveraging customer experience to drive product strategy and vision.
  • Familiarity with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)

Key Skills:

  • Strategic thinking and business acumen.
  • Data-driven decision making.
  • Cross-functional collaboration.
  • Agile mindset and user experience design.
  • Stakeholder management and relationship building.
  • Coaching, mentoring, and talent development.
  • Process improvement and operational excellence.
  • Implementation of health IT standards.
  • Ability to create and communicate a unified vision

Additional Information:

As part of our hiring process for this opportunity, we will be using an interviewing technology called HireVue to enhance our hiring and decision-making ability. HireVue allows us to quickly connect and gain valuable information from you pertaining to your relevant skills and experience at a time that is best for your schedule.

Work at home requirements:

To ensure Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees‚Äô ability to work effectively, the self-provided internet service of Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees must meet the following criteria:
At minimum, a download speed of 25 Mbps and an upload speed of 10 Mbps is required; wireless, wired cable or DSL connection is suggested.
Satellite, cellular and microwave connection can be used only if approved by leadership.
Employees who live and work from Home in the state of California, Illinois, Montana, or South Dakota will be provided a bi-weekly payment for their internet expense.
Humana will provide Home or Hybrid Home/Office employees with telephone equipment appropriate to meet the business requirements for their position/job.
Work from a dedicated space lacking ongoing interruptions to protect member PHI / HIPAA information.

SSN Alert:

Humana values personal identity protection. Please be aware that applicants may be asked to provide their Social Security Number, if it is not already on file. When required, an email will be sent from Humana@myworkday.com with instructions on how to add the information into your official application on Humana‚Äôs secure website.

Travel: While this is a remote position, occasional travel to Humana's offices for training or meetings may be required.

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

Pay Range

The compensation range below reflects a good faith estimate of starting base pay for full time (40 hours per week) employment at the time of posting. The pay range may be higher or lower based on geographic location and individual pay will vary based on demonstrated job related skills, knowledge, experience, education, certifications, etc.$168,000 - $231,000 per yearThis job is eligible for a bonus incentive plan. This incentive opportunity is based upon company and/or individual performance.

Description of Benefits

Humana, Inc. and its affiliated subsidiaries (collectively, ‚ÄúHumana‚Äù) offers competitive benefits that support whole-person well-being. Associate benefits are designed to encourage personal wellness and smart healthcare decisions for you and your family while also knowing your life extends outside of work. Among our benefits, Humana provides medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) retirement savings plan, time off (including paid time off, company and personal holidays, volunteer time off, paid parental and caregiver leave), short-term and long-term disability, life insurance and many other opportunities.Application Deadline: 02-05-2026


About us

About CenterWell Senior Primary Care: CenterWell Senior Primary Care provides proactive, preventive care to seniors, including wellness visits, physical exams, chronic condition management, screenings, minor injury treatment and more. Our unique care model focuses on personalized experiences, taking time to listen, learn and address the factors that impact patient well-being. Our integrated care teams, which include physicians, nurses, behavioral health specialists and more, spend up to 50 percent more time with patients, providing compassionate, personalized care that brings better health outcomes. We go beyond physical health by also addressing other factors that can impact a patient‚Äôs well-being.About CenterWell, a Humana company: CenterWell creates experiences that put patients at the center. As the nation‚Äôs largest provider of senior-focused primary care, one of the largest providers of home health services, and fourth largest pharmacy benefit manager, CenterWell is focused on whole-person health by addressing the physical, emotional and social wellness of our patients. As part of Humana Inc. (NYSE: HUM), CenterWell offers stability, industry-leading benefits, and opportunities to grow yourself and your career. We proudly employ more than 30,000 clinicians who are committed to putting health first ‚Äì for our teammates, patients, communities and company. By providing flexible scheduling options, clinical certifications, leadership development programs and career coaching, we allow employees to invest in their personal and professional well-being, all from day one.

‚Äã

Equal Opportunity Employer

It is the policy of Humana not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. It is also the policy of Humana to take affirmative action, in compliance with Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act and VEVRAA, to employ and to advance in employment individuals with disability or protected veteran status, and to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements. This policy shall apply to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, upgrading, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, recall, termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation and selection for training, including apprenticeship, at all levels of employment.

raw.title: Remote - Staff Controls Engineer (Hershey, PA, US)
raw.excerpt: Job Location: RemoteSummary: Reporting to the Director of Salty Snacks Engineering group, the Staff Controls Engineer leads the development, execution, and implementation control systems in projects of major importance, complexity and scope.
raw.description:
Job Location: Remote

Summary:

Reporting to the Director of Salty Snacks Engineering group, the Staff Controls Engineer leads the development, execution, and implementation control systems in projects of major importance, complexity and scope. They must have proven capability to demonstrate and apply, as well as develop and share, technical expertise within their functional area and cross-functionally within the organization. They must have familiarity with agile software development methodologies and digital solution deployment. A successful candidate must have proven problem-solving skills and possess the ability to think critically. They must possess a capability to communicate technical subject matter, written and verbally, cross functionally with their manager. Successful candidate must have proven capability to communicate complex or technical subject matter, both written and verbally, to audiences at all levels of the organization with proven capability to influence stakeholders and leverage personal networks to provide engineering solutions.

Specific Role Focus Area:

  • Leads the development/assessment of state-of-the-art control systems suitable for a food manufacturing facility that meet project requirements and business objectives.
  • Leads selection, design, installation and commissioning of control systems and automated equipment in the execution of capital projects, meeting budget, schedule, and scope.
  • Identifies opportunities for digital manufacturing applications, guiding project teams, and assessing new technologies for performance improvements and business value.
  • Manages large and/or complex capital projects, including cost, schedule, and resources (internal and contract)
  • Problem solving through application of experience, research, and critical thinking.
  • Strong technical expertise in manufacturing automation systems and components.
  • Strong understanding of Hershey processes, equipment, and regulatory requirements.
  • Effective communicator with multifunctional team members and Hershey management.

This role will interact and partner with:

  • Technical and professional employees within Global Engineering
  • Plant Engineering, Manufacturing, Operations and Quality Assurance
  • Quality and Regulatory Compliance
  • Procurement
  • External Vendors

Travel Expectations:

  • This role will require travel, domestic and international, based on project assignments. Average 30% over time but may be 60% to 80% during certain project phases.

Major Duties/Responsibilities:

Time %

Summary of major duties:

1.

20%

Capital Project Development:

  • Leads multifunctional teams in the development of capital projects, preparing manufacturing feasibility assessments and capital cost estimates for multiple capital projects.
  • Evaluate new technologies.
  • Proficient in the use and application of Hershey Engineering Standards and relevant industry standards.
  • Proven capability to apply applicable control system technologies, programming methods, instrumentation and other processes that benefit Hershey capital project requirements and business objectives.

2.

75%

Capital Project Execution:

  • Leads the design of process control systems and evaluation/selection of packaging and process equipment control systems suitable for implementation in a food manufacturing facility and within the project scope, budget, and timeline.
  • Ensure network infrastructure, machinery networks, and installations are in conformance with the Hershey Industrial Control Network guidelines and cybersecurity policies.
  • Prepares electrical schematics, bid specifications for processes, equipment, equipment installation, electrical distribution infrastructure and industrial control network infrastructure.
  • Oversees the controls portion of installation, checkout and startup of processes and equipment, managing cost, schedule, and resources (internal and external) in a multifunctional team environment.
  • Lead process and packaging controls optimization during startup and early production.
  • Lead digital transformation initiatives on the factory floor, driving adoption of new technologies and continuous improvement.
  • Ensures network infrastructure and machinery networks conform to industrial control network guidelines and cybersecurity policies.
  • Hone control system troubleshooting skills for processes and equipment.
  • Communicate with and train manufacturing personnel including operators and supervisors in operations of implemented control systems.
  • Communicate with and train maintenance and specialist personnel in the technical details of implemented control systems.

3.

5%

Skills Development:

  • Mentors and guides less experienced controls engineers and co-ops/interns in engineering projects.
  • Provides training to others for the Skills Diversification program.

Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities:

Salty Snacks, Confectionary, Food, Consumer Goods or Pharmaceutical experience is desirable. The preferred candidate will have demonstrated knowledge and experience that is required to design, specify, estimate, install, configure, program, troubleshoot and maintain state of the art control systems for discrete, batch and continuous process systems. Candidates are required to have basic knowledge of Industrial Control Network architectures, hardware, design, topologies, protocols.

  • Expert in the application and programming of PLCs/PACs, Rockwell and Siemens preferred.
  • Demonstrated knowledge in the application and programming of motion control systems, Rockwell and Siemens preferred.
  • Expert in the application and configuration of HMI/SCADA systems, FactoryTalk SE/ME and Ignition preferred.
  • Experience with the Redzone connected workforce application.
  • Proven experience implementing and supporting digital manufacturing systems such as digital automation, MES, IIOT, data analytics and integration of IT.OT systems,
  • Expert in the application of common process instrumentation (temperature, level, pressure, flow, mass).
  • Advanced knowledge of regulatory requirements for electrical installations.
  • Experience in developing electrical schematics, P&IDs, control system design, and project estimation is required.
  • Experience in developing, specifying, and installing 480 VAC, 120 VAC, and 24 VDC power systems is required.
  • Experience in basic ethernet network architectures and device configuration.
  • Technical Troubleshooting skills, including hands-on problem-solving experience focusing on detailed problem resolution and documentation.
  • Demonstrated leadership and decision-making skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Must be open to and comfortable with change.
  • Must be able to execute projects to a defined schedule and budget.
  • Open to travel (including International) based on assignment (>30%).

Minimum Education and Experience Requirements:

Education and Experience:

  • BS in Engineering, Engineering Technology, or related Engineering Field.
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in controls engineering for Food Processing, Confectionery, Pharmaceutical or related industries.

Company Overview

Kairos Power is a new nuclear energy technology and engineering company whose mission is to enable the world‚Äôs transition to clean energy, with the ultimate goal to dramatically improve people‚Äôs quality of life while protecting the environment. This goal will be accomplished through the commercialization of the fluoride-salt-cooled, high-temperature reactor (FHR) that can be deployed with robust safety, affordable costs, and flexible operation to accommodate the expansion of variable renewables.

Job Summary

Kairos Power is seeking a motivated Finance Intern to engage in daily finance processes, analytics, and reporting. In this collaborative environment, the intern will work under the guidance of the Senior Financial Analyst and alongside experienced peers to support operational and analytical finance initiatives.

Responsibilities

  • Prepare and enhance quarterly management reporting files using Tableau, Excel and Power Point.
  • Support data-driven insights by leveraging Alteryx and Tableau for financial and operational analyses.
  • Assist with preparation of project reports and collaborate with project managers on monthly and/or quarterly project tracking and status updates.
  • Work alongside the Supply Chain and Procurement team to streamline Purchase Order management and develop analytics to track key metrics.
  • Prepare ad-hoc financial and analytical reports as needed or requested.
  • Support the Senior Financial Analyst with weekly cash flow reporting and forecasting updates.
  • Update and maintain forecasting and budgeting files, ensuring data accuracy and integrity across systems.
  • Acquire business acumen to support accurate expenditure coding on Purchase Orders.
  • Actively engage in continuous learning opportunities, particularly in data analytics and process automation.
  • Gain proficiency in accounting/finance and analytics software, including NetSuite, Coupa, Tableau and Alteryx.
  • Assist with data validation, reconciliation, and quality checks to support accurate financial reporting.
  • Assist with data validation, reconciliation, and quality checks to support accurate financial reporting.
  • Document financial processes, reporting methodologies, or analytical assumptions to support transparency and repeatability.
  • Support month-end or quarter-end close activities through data preparation or variance analysis, as appropriate for an intern role.
  • Participate in cross-functional meetings to gain exposure to business operations and financial decision-making processes.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • Current student pursuing a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in accounting, finance, data analytics, or a related field.
  • Demonstrated experience or coursework in data visualization, business intelligence, or analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, SQL).
  • Interest in a high-growth technology company, with an appreciation for clean energy.
  • Proficient in Excel; GAAP knowledge preferred.
  • Exposure to enterprise resource planning (ERP) or financial systems through coursework, projects, or prior internships is desirable.
  • Exposure to enterprise resource planning (ERP) or financial systems through coursework, projects, or prior internships is desirable.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Ability to solve problems quickly and efficiently.
  • Strong analytical mindset with an ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights clearly.
  • Basic understanding of financial statements and how operational activities impact financial performance.
  • Proactively seeks opportunities for learning, development, and new challenges.
  • Adaptable and flexible in fast-paced environments, adjusting to shifting priorities.
  • High attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision.
  • Eager to engage in teamwork in a collaborative environment.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality when handling sensitive financial and business information.
  • Basic understanding of financial statements and how operational activities impact financial performance.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to track work, document assumptions, and follow established processes.

Physical Demands

  • Remaining in a stationary position, often standing, or sitting for prolonged periods‚ÄØ

Environmental Conditions

  • General office environment
  • Assessing the accuracy, neatness and thoroughness of the work assigned
  • High-concentration, demanding and fast-paced

Safety and PPE

  • Reading and interpreting hazardous warning signs
  • Reporting issues with equipment or unsafe conditions

About our Benefits

We know that we have some of the most talented and dedicated employees, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, full-time employees (excludes interns) expect to have access to the benefits below:

  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Medical, dental and vision benefits for employees and their dependents
  • Paid Vacation
  • 401(k) and pre-tax health insurance, dependent care, and commuter benefits (FSA)

Kairos Power is committed to building a diverse workforce that reflects the communities where we do business. Kairos Power is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We actively welcome people of different experiences, abilities, and perspectives.

Kairos Power participates in E-Verify.

Candidates only, no recruiters or agencies please.

Note: You are applying for a position that is located in a facility that handles information that is subject to export control restrictions by the Department of Energy under 10 CFR Part 810. To work in this facility, you need to be authorized by the Department of Energy to access Part 810-controlled information. Foreign nationals who are citizens of countries that are not on the Department of Energy‚Äôs general authorization list (link below) are not permitted to work in our facility unless the Department of Energy issues an export control license to the company to permit that individual to have access to Part 810-controlled information. The following questions are intended to determine the licensing requirements that may apply. https://www.law.cornell.edu/cfr/text/10/appendix-A_to_part_810

raw.excerpt: OJ Digital Solutions is seeking a motivated and experienced Graphic Designer to join our 100% remote team as a contract / per-task based role.
raw.description:
OJ Digital Solutions is seeking a motivated and experienced Graphic Designer to join our 100% remote team as a contract / per-task based role.

We will generally be needing these types of tasks (no need to know how to do them all)

  1. Taking product images and turning it into high-quality lifestyle images or infographics that will be used mainly for Amazon and other ecommerce platforms.
  2. Create packaging designs

IMPORTANT NOTE: You don't need to know how to do all of the above, as we can assign tasks depending on your expertise.

TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED.

Our Company Values:

  • It's not a corporate environment
  • We're flexible and easy going, but serious and responsible about meeting deadlines
  • We don't like micromanagement, so we want to trust that you will manage your time well
  • We're in a fast paced environment, so we expect great communication

Requirements

Qualifications & Requirements:

  • Proficiency in graphic design software, such as Adobe Creative Suite (Figma is a big plus)
  • At least 3 years of graphic design experience
  • Must be creative, can come up with ideas without too detailed instructions
  • Must be a self-starter, can take initiative, and work without supervision
  • Excellent Written English (No typos!)
  • Must have good communication skills and the ability to proactively communicate
  • Must be committed, focused, detail-oriented and professional
  • Ability to understand what the client expects and apply to the designs
  • Strong interpersonal skills to work harmoniously with other professionals

Benefits

Set-up & compensation:

  • Fully remote
  • Flexible in terms of assignments (we can assign as much as you can handle)
  • We're looking for these rates (can discuss further once you're onboarded)
    • For product infographics: $5-$7 per unique image (easy variations included)**
    • For packaging, we're looking at $15-$20 per task

**Clarification: For product images, we usually assign projects that include 5 to 14 images per task, not 1 by 1, so that means the order value is generally high.

We seek a dynamic and result-oriented Corporate Partnerships Executive to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and executing strategic partnerships, driving sales growth, and expanding our business reach. The role requires strong negotiation skills, excellent communication, and a proven track record of successful partnerships in a corporate setting.

  1. Identify and target potential partners and organizations to establish strategic partnerships that align with the company's goals and objectives.
  2. Build and maintain relationships with key decision-makers, stakeholders, and industry influencers to expand business opportunities.
  3. Conduct market research and analysis to identify new market trends, competitive landscape, and potential partnership opportunities.
  4. Negotiate partnership agreements, contracts, and terms to ensure mutually beneficial outcomes.
  5. Collaborate with internal teams, such as marketing, product development, and operations, to align partnership initiatives and drive successful implementation.
  6. Provide timely and accurate reports on partnership activities, and market trends to management.
  7. Stay updated with industry developments, market trends, and competitor activities to identify potential risks or opportunities.
  8. Attend industry events, conferences, and networking sessions to enhance the company's visibility and establish relationships with key industry players.
  1. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or a related field. MBA is a plus.
  2. Proven track record of successful partnerships in a corporate setting.
  3. Strong negotiation, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  4. Excellent communication and relationship-building abilities.
  5. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  6. Results-driven with a strategic mindset and strong business acumen.
  7. Proficiency in using CRM software and other sales tools.
  8. Knowledge of the industry and market trends.
  9. Willingness to travel as required.

This is a contract/consultancy role. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Sumundi for an agreed period. This role is fully remote. Notwithstanding, you will be required to submit reports on an agreed day and time, on a weekly/bi-weekly basis, and also required to be in the position to meet certain potential partners in person in order to close an agreement.

Sumundi is committed to developing and delivering cutting-edge software solutions to businesses of all sizes and individuals. We aim to increase productivity and scalability while leading innovation and digital transformation. Through continuous learning and a goal-driven strategy, we aspire to be a catalyst of change ensuring that every client reaches their full potential in the growing digital marketplace.

raw.title: Business Development and Account Manager (Medical) (Virtual, US, 99999)
raw.excerpt: About Us:Join AMETEKPower Quality Solutions, a leader in safeguarding sensitive equipment from power disruptions like spikes, blackouts, and electrical noise.
raw.description:
About Us:

Join AMETEKPower Quality Solutions, a leader in safeguarding sensitive equipment from power disruptions like spikes, blackouts, and electrical noise. As part of our team, you‚Äôll help ensure smooth, reliable power for critical systems worldwide. This is your chance to create innovative solutions and make a real difference in keeping vital systems running strong.

Job Summary:

Ametek is looking for a high-performing sales professional to lead business development and manage strategic accounts in the healthcare and medical device sectors. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on building relationships, closing deals, and delivering value-driven solutions.

The ideal candidate should have a high sense of urgency to create the best possible customer experience for our customers. We‚Äôre seeking a qualified sales representative to help provide our customers with power quality and uninterrupted power supply solutions which are manufactured by the Powervar brand of Ametek. The sales representative will have a strong understanding of the sales process and excel at generating leads, building relationships, and closing deals. The ideal candidate will be a quick learner who has strong negotiating skills and an ability to showcase the value we bring a compelling way. Often tasked with giving presentations and attending networking events and trade shows, the sales representative must be both personable and professional with excellent organization and communication skills along with attention to detail and accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Own and grow key accounts across clinical labs, hospital systems, and leading medical device manufacturers
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders such as lab managers, biomedical engineers, procurement teams, and C-suite executives in healthcare organizations
  • Manage sales and account relationships with leading medical device manufacturers (e.g., Beckman Coulter, Alcon, Agilent, Noah, Intuitive, Stryker)
  • Focus on client engagement of both new account opportunities and existing clients to discover, build value, and move forward with solutions which provide both client and business objective success
  • Blueprint client account structure. Maintain key relationships within departments (i.e., Executive Groups, Sales Group, Marketing Group, Service Group), as needed to ensure high client satisfaction
  • Maintain client database (via Salesforce) and delegate time accordingly to ensure monthly objectives are met. Monitor sales updates, forecasting, reports, etc.
  • Participate in developing marketing strategy and supporting go-to-market plans for new medical technologies and robotics solutions. Provide sales information to management team. Provide analysis and marketing/training assessment needs to support Powervar sales plans
  • Prepare and execute presentations to large groups as needed
  • Coordinate engineering effort when Powervar products are required on new systems
  • Work with management team to define and execute future plans for growth including new applications, new vertical markets, and new product development plans
  • Work with internal departments (Order Entry, Service, Accounting, etc.) to ensure clients remain in good standing and are well-informed. Assist with process improvement initiatives when required
  • Attend trade shows to support sales/engineering teams
  • Travel is expected to be at least 50%

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5-7 years of sales/client engagement experience
  • Power and/or electrical industry experience
  • Experience selling to clinical laboratories, hospitals, and medical device manufacturers
  • Salesforce experience
  • Willingness to travel ~50%

Desired Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical field
  • Experience with uninterruptible power supplies (UPS)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Strong interpersonal skills to build rapport
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and Word knowledge
  • Power BI and One Note experience
  • Effective organizational and time management skills to succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Knowledge of robotics applications in healthcare
  • Familiarity with medical diagnostics, laboratory automation, and robotics solutions

What‚Äôs in It for You:

  • Competitive compensation, holiday pay, and paid time off
  • Great benefits package that includes health, vision, and dental insurance
  • 401(k), plus matching
  • Flexible spending accounts (FSAs), health savings account (HSA) with AMETEK contribution, life insurance, disability insurance, and family medical leave
  • Employee referral program
  • Tuition reimbursement program
  • Employee assistance program
  • Exciting, fast-paced environment where you could make a true impact
  • Opportunities for career advancement within our business unit and across all other AMETEK business entities

Additional Details:

This is a remote role.

To learn more about our company and our job opportunities, visit us at: https://www.ametek.com/careers

To learn more about the business unit you‚Äôll be joining, visit us at: https://www.powervar.com/

Job Summary:

We are looking for an experienced and talented Product Services Supervisor to join our team. This individual will be responsible for directly managing a team of CAD/CAM product support specialists through daily support, coaching, and development. This includes establishing performance goals, providing formal one-on-one feedback on call handling and troubleshooting, and writing and delivering performance evaluations. This role also includes overseeing daily operations, optimizing workflows and ensuring the delivery of high-quality technical assistance to dental professionals using our CAD/CAM Systems. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership capabilities, deep technical knowledge of dental CAD/CAM systems and a commitment to customer satisfaction.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversees day-to-day support for dental CAD/CAM software and hardware, including intraoral scanners, milling machines, and design platforms
  • Ensures timely and accurate answers are provided to customers across time zones and support channels (phone, email and remote sessions)
  • Provides guidance on complex troubleshooting scenarios including software crashes, hardware calibration, network connectivity issues and third-party systems integrations
  • Maintains an open environment that encourages team member participation in process improvements and problem resolution
  • Serves as an escalation point for product support specialists, ensure consistency of performance standards within the department, and escalate customer issues when necessary
  • Evaluates individual and team productivity on a regular basis and guide the development of solutions to improve performance at the individual and team level
  • Monitors call and ticket quality and provide appropriate formal and ad hoc coaching to team members
  • Coaches employees on career development and growth opportunities and support the development of action plans to facilitate their desired outcomes
  • Manages attendance and punctuality in alignment with corporate policy guidance and departmental practices
  • Coordinates work schedules and vacation time to ensure department needs are met
  • Ensures team members are up to date on current initiatives and priorities
  • Creates and maintain a high level of employee satisfaction and minimize turnover
  • Promotes excellent relationships with other departments by reinforcing communication around service trends, process updates, and quality issue intervention
  • Oversees the support representatives training and help ensure their readiness to support customers
  • Perform other duties as necessary

Education:

  • Minimum 2-year College Degree required
  • Bachelor‚Äôs Degree preferred

Years and Type of Experience

  • Minimum of 4 years‚Äô experience in CAD/CAM Technical Support on phone and/or training of related work experience
  • Previous leadership or management experience in CAD/CAM Technical Support
  • Experience with customer service-related work
  • Experience with troubleshooting equipment, technology and related products
  • CAD/CAM and Digital Dentistry experience preferred
  • Must be experienced in troubleshooting computer hardware, Windows Operating Systems, and Applications and/or experience installing and troubleshooting computer networks

Dentsply Sirona is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or protected Veteran status. We appreciate your interest in Dentsply Sirona.

If you need assistance with completing the online application due to a disability, please send an accommodation request to careers@dentsplysirona.com. Please be sure to include ‚ÄúAccommodation Request‚Äù in the subject.

For California Residents:

We may collect the following categories of personal information in connection with the submission of your resume or application materials to us for employment, and if hired, your employment with us: identifiers (e.g., name, address, email address, birthdate); personal records (e.g., telephone number, signature, education information, criminal background information, passport number and visa information); consumer characteristics (e.g., sex, marital status, veteran status, race, disability, sexual orientation); professional or employment information (e.g., resume, cover letter, employment history, background check forms, references, certifications, transcripts and languages spoken); and inferences from personal information collected (e.g., a profile reflecting abilities and aptitudes).

The above categories of personal information are collected for the following business purposes: performing recruitment and hiring services; processing interactions and transactions (e.g., to comply with federal and state laws requiring us to maintain certain records, managing the workforce); and security (e.g., detecting security incidents, protecting against fraudulent or illegal activity).

For additional details and questions, contact us at careers@dentsplysirona.com

raw.description:
Join beqom - where tech meets impact

beqom is a high-growth B2B SaaS company that provides industry-leading tools for pay equity and transparency, compensation, and performance management.

Trusted by some of the world‚Äôs most respected companies, beqom enables HR and business leaders to navigate global compliance and make smarter pay decisions that attract, retain, and motivate top talent.

Founded in Switzerland and serving clients worldwide, our powerful, enterprise-ready products are fueled by beqom pay intelligence.

The Role

As an Account Manager at beqom, you will be responsible for a portfolio of enterprise clients using both our historical compensation management platform and our new platform offerings (Pay Equity, Pay Transparency, and next-generation Compensation & Performance Management solutions).

You will act as the key commercial contact for your accounts, driving retention and growth, managing renewals, identifying upsell opportunities, and ensuring long-term client satisfaction. You‚Äôll engage with a variety of stakeholders (HR, IT, Procurement, Finance) across different industries and implementation contexts.

This is a strategic role, requiring strong business acumen, autonomy, and the ability to work across teams (Pre-Sales, Support, Services, Legal, etc.) to deliver value and strengthen our client partnerships over time.

What will you be doing?

  • Own and manage the overall relationship with your assigned accounts.
  • Drive account performance of ‚â•95% GRR and ‚â•115% NRR year-on-year across your account portfolio.
  • Lead renewal cycles and support the negotiation of commercial and contractual terms.
  • Identify and qualify upsell and cross-sell opportunities and drive them through to close.
  • Build and maintain long-term relationships with key stakeholders at various levels (C-suite, HR leadership, IT, Procurement, etc.).
  • Serve as the internal advocate for your clients, ensuring alignment across beqom teams.
  • Monitor adoption and satisfaction across your portfolio, and proactively manage risks.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to address client requests and ensure smooth execution.
  • Provide regular account updates, contribute to internal planning and forecasting.
  • Stay up to date on compensation trends and beqom‚Äôs evolving product landscape.

What are we looking for?

  • 5+ years of experience in B2B Account Management
  • Proven track record in managing large or complex customer accounts over multi-year relationships.
  • Ability to navigate both legacy and new product environments, with a structured and adaptable approach.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to engage confidently with executive and operational stakeholders.
  • Strong sense of ownership, strategic mindset, and commercial acumen.
  • Comfortable working cross-functionally and coordinating multiple internal stakeholders.
  • Fluent in English and German (written and spoken).
  • Willingness to travel (approx. 2-3 days per month), depending on client needs.

Bonus points if you have:

  • Account Management experience in SaaS, HR Tech or enterprise software sectors.

Why join us?

  • Your career, your design. Unleash your ambition in our dynamic, autonomous environment.
  • Drive meaningful change. Build a fairer future for every employee by joining a market leader that is improving the world of work.
  • Belong to something bigger. Collaborate with a passionate, diverse and talented team around the globe.

Applications must be submitted in English.

raw.title: Golang Lead
raw.excerpt: Hi!  We‚Äôre Mercuryo, and we‚Äôre on a mission to redefine finance by blending the best of traditional banking with the innovations of decentralized finance (DeFi).
raw.description:
Hi! We‚Äôre Mercuryo, and we‚Äôre on a mission to redefine finance by blending the best of traditional banking with the innovations of decentralized finance (DeFi). We believe that everyone should have easy access to Web3 and traditional financial services ‚Äî and we‚Äôre making that happen by building a robust platform that simplifies dealing with crypto and seamlessly integrates it into the broader financial ecosystem.

Since we launched in 2018, we‚Äôve teamed up with Web3 top projects such as MetaMask, Trust Wallet, Ledger, Jupiter, 1inch, and PancakeSwap and 200+ others to power over 200 dynamic products. Our work also brings us into direct collaboration with major ecosystems such as Solana Labs, Consensys, and BNB Chain. We‚Äôre just getting started, and we want you to help us shape the future of money!

Why Mercuryo?

Industry Impact

Join us in helping world-class Web3 projects onboard millions of new users into the next generation of finance.

Innovative Environment

Collaborate with more than 300 talented professionals from diverse backgrounds ‚Äî including banking, SaaS, and Web3 ‚Äî all united in delivering outstanding user experiences.

Growth and Learning

Our expanding network of 200+ B2B partnerships and a user base of over 7 million means there‚Äôs always room to grow your skills, tackle new challenges, and push boundaries.

Flexible Culture

We‚Äôre remote-first, celebrating diversity across 30 countries. At Mercuryo, you‚Äôll be empowered to take ownership of your work, spark creativity, and shape how we move forward together.

About the Role:

We are looking for a Golang Tech Lead to drive technical excellence in our backend team. This is a hands-on role focused on solving complex engineering challenges, designing scalable architecture for high-load systems, and setting technical standards. You will act as the primary technical authority, ensuring our solutions are robust, efficient, and future-proof.

Your Role:

  • Architecture & Complex Solutions: Design and implement architectural solutions for high-load SOA systems. Solve non-trivial technical problems and optimize critical system components.
  • Technical Leadership: Define coding standards, conduct code reviews, and drive technical decision-making within the team.
  • Refactoring, optimization, and development of new features.
  • Document APIs and technical designs.
  • Collaborate with QA, DevOps, Analytics, and Product Managers to align technical execution with product goals.

What We're Looking For:

  • Proven experience designing and building complex, high-load distributed systems.
  • 4+ years of experience with Golang in projects with SOA.
  • Communication skills (ability to argue technical decisions and share knowledge).
  • Use Golang toolchain including pprof, delve, linters.
  • GIT commands and flows.
  • SQL, distinguishing between PostgresSQL and MySQL dialects.
  • Message brokers including RabbitMQ, Kafka, NATS.
  • Redis commands.
  • Docker, including writing Docker files.

Nice to have:

  • Deep understanding of architectural patterns in SOA.
  • Experience in banking industry.
  • Experience with cryptocurrency projects.
  • Publicly available open source projects (profile on github, etc.).

What We Offer:

  • Competitive market rate salary and performance-based incentives.
  • 22 days annual leave with an additional 6 company days, plus bank holidays.
  • Comprehensive health insurance plans.
  • Extensive benefits program.
  • Flexible work schedule and remote work options.
  • Modern offices and co-working spaces across 6 countries.
  • Working equipment.
  • Professional development and training opportunities.
  • Opportunity to shape the initiatives you‚Äôre working on.
  • Diverse and friendly team.
  • We are open-minded to new ideas.

Join Us!

title: L5 Software Solution Architect - TELUS TV Platform (Toronto, ON, CA)
description: Description Shape the future of video, entertainment, and digital platforms Are you a passionate Solution Architect who thrives on designing end-to-end solutions that span multiple squads, backend systems, and client applications?

raw.title: L5 Software Solution Architect - TELUS TV Platform (Toronto, ON, CA)
raw.excerpt: Description Shape the future of video, entertainment, and digital platforms Are you a passionate Solution Architect who thrives on designing end-to-end solutions that span multiple squads, backend systems, and client applications?
raw.description:
Description

Shape the future of video, entertainment, and digital platforms

Are you a passionate Solution Architect who thrives on designing end-to-end solutions that span multiple squads, backend systems, and client applications? Do you enjoy partnering with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to deliver seamless customer experiences? If so, TELUS is looking for you to join our Platform & Services team to help shape the next generation of TELUS TV+ services.

In this role, you will provide technical leadership, architectural guidance, and operational insight to ensure our solutions are scalable, reliable, and aligned with business priorities. You‚Äôll mentor engineers, work closely with squads, and help improve the overall software development lifecycle (SDLC), while championing a DevOps-first mindset and customer-centric delivery.

What you‚Äôll do

Architect End-to-End Solutions

  • Design and deliver integrated solutions spanning metadata services, client-facing APIs, and multi-platform applications (iOS, Android, Web, FireTV, etc.)
  • Collaborate with product managers, engineering leads, and stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical roadmaps and scalable architectures
  • Ensure seamless integration between backend services and client applications, focusing on performance, resiliency, and user experience
  • Integrate security best practices and compliance requirements into every layer of the architecture, ensuring safe handling of user data and content.

Technical Leadership & Mentorship

  • Provide architectural direction across multiple squads and engineering domains (backend, client, API, and data)
  • Mentor engineers and guide teams through best practices in API design, data flows, and system integration
  • Foster a culture of knowledge sharing, innovation, and technical excellence

Drive SDLC Improvements & Operational Excellence

  • Partner with squads to optimize delivery pipelines, enhance release practices, and improve engineering velocity
  • Champion a DevOps-first approach, focusing on observability, automation, and continuous delivery
  • Work closely with operations and engineering teams to proactively identify and resolve customer-impacting issues

Qualifications

What you bring

  • 8+ years of experience in software architecture or solution design for large-scale, distributed systems
  • Proven track record delivering cloud-native, microservices-based solutions (GCP, AWS, or Azure)
  • Strong expertise in API design, data modeling, and service integration
  • Hands-on experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShift)
  • Experience with event-driven architectures (Kafka, Pub/Sub, or equivalent) for high-throughput systems
  • Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines, DevOps automation, and modern software delivery practices
  • Excellent collaboration skills and ability to align multiple squads, stakeholders, and product teams
  • Deep understanding of security best practices in distributed systems, including identity management, encryption, and API security
  • Strong knowledge of scalability patterns (caching strategies, load balancing, failover, disaster recovery)

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in video streaming platforms, metadata systems, or large-scale content delivery
  • Familiarity with GCP native services (Cloud Run, GKE, Pub/Sub, Spanner, BigQuery)
  • Knowledge of observability platforms (Splunk, Dynatrace, Datadog) and performance tuning techniques
  • Understanding of SAFE/Agile delivery frameworks and cross-squad planning practices
  • Hands-on development experience in Java, Node.js, or modern client frameworks (React, Vue, Angular)
  • Exposure to edge computing or CDN architectures (Akamai, CloudFront, Cloudflare) for video delivery
  • Experience in infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Helm, Pulumi) for scalable cloud deployments
  • Knowledge of real-time analytics and monitoring pipelines for customer experience (QoS, playback metrics, churn prediction)
  • Background in cost optimization strategies for large-scale cloud services
  • Familiarity with multi-region deployments and blue/green or canary release strategies

LI-HYBRID

At TELUS, you‚Äôll help shape the future of digital entertainment for millions of Canadians. You‚Äôll work alongside a collaborative, innovative, and passionate team dedicated to engineering excellence and customer impact. We foster an inclusive culture that values diverse perspectives, continuous learning, and leadership at every level.

Be part of something big. Build solutions that power the future of TV.

title: Summer Co-op/UX/UI Design
description: Why GSK? Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

raw.title: Summer Co-op/UX/UI Design
raw.excerpt: Why GSK? Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.
raw.description:
Why GSK?

Uniting science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together.

GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose ‚Äì to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together ‚Äì so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns ‚Äì as an organisation where people can thrive. We prevent and treat disease with vaccines, specialty and general medicines. We focus on the science of the immune system and the use of new platform and data technologies, investing in four core therapeutic areas (infectious diseases, HIV, respiratory/ immunology and oncology).

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it‚Äôs also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves ‚Äì feeling welcome, valued, and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

Department Description

GSK aims to deliver intuitive, efficient, and effective digital products and services for our internal groups and external pharmaceutical or healthcare customers. We are seeking a UX/UI Design Co-op to support the Digital and AI Customer Experience portfolio within the Enterprise AI group.

Job Description

This role is designed for an early‚Äëcareer designer with enthusiasm for user‚Äëcentred design, communication design, and digital product development. The Co-op will learn from experienced designers, product managers, and engineers while contributing to real projects across research, interaction design, visual communication, and design system work.

The role is ideal for someone who is multi‚Äëdisciplinary, creative, and eager to grow‚Äîparticularly someone with interests in branding, storytelling, visual communication, digital layout, and crafting meaningful experiences.

Key Responsibilities:

Communication Design & Visual Storytelling

  • Support the creation of visual assets, presentations, layouts, and branded materials that communicate design ideas clearly.
  • Apply visual hierarchy, typography, colour, and composition principles to support UX/UI work.
  • Contribute to design storytelling by preparing mock‚Äëups, concept boards, simple animations, design communications or digital content.
  • Help maintain consistency across products by following brand and design‚Äësystem guidelines.
  • Assist in creating engaging digital experiences inspired by multi‚Äëdisciplinary design approaches such as concepts, prototypes and visual communications.

Research & Discovery

  • Support research activities (note‚Äëtaking, preparing materials, organising findings).
  • Learn how user insights shape product decisions.
  • Observe user interviews, usability tests, and feedback sessions.
  • Help summarise insights visually (simple diagrams, artefacts, or recap slides).

Experience & Interaction Design

  • Assist in creating user flows, simple journey maps, and basic wireframes.
  • Learn and apply Information Architecture principles under guidance.
  • Contribute to low‚Äëfidelity prototypes and simple UI mock‚Äëups using templates or existing design‚Äësystem components.
  • Support preparation of design files for critiques, workshops, and reviews.

Design Delivery & Execution

  • Support updates to design‚Äësystem components and documentation.
  • Learn accessibility and inclusive‚Äëdesign best practices and apply them to basic tasks.
  • Help prepare visuals, assets, and annotated files for engineering handover.
  • Contribute to responsive layout considerations across screen sizes and devices.

Collaboration & Product Alignment

  • Participate in team meetings and design activities with UX designers, PMs, engineers, and researchers.
  • Assist in documenting design requirements, decisions, and rationale.
  • Learn how discovery, design, and delivery fit together in Agile product teams.
  • Contribute to team culture through workshops, brainstorms, and design critiques.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Pursuing a degree in UX/UI Design, or related disciplines.
  • A portfolio demonstrating potential in visual communication, digital design, or conceptual projects (e.g., branding, motion, packaging, exhibitions, or student UX/UI projects).
  • Foundational understanding of user‚Äëcentred design (taught, self‚Äëlearned, or project-based).
  • Familiarity with design tools such as Figma, Illustrator, Photoshop, or similar.
  • Interest in UX/UI methodologies including personas, wireframes, journey maps, and prototypes.
  • Awareness of responsive design principles and digital content layout.
  • Curiosity about front‚Äëend technologies (HTML/CSS) to understand how designs translate into products.
  • Strong communication skills‚Äîvisual and verbal‚Äîwith an eagerness to learn and accept feedback.
  • Proactive attitude, strong attention to detail, and a desire to create meaningful experiences.
  • Must be able to work full-time (35-40 hours/week) throughout the duration of the 6 month co-op (June ~ December 2026).
  • Must have an active‚ÄØstudent status and/or within 12 months post-graduation from a BS or MS degree program. Post-doctoral‚ÄØcandidates are not eligible.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Coursework, personal projects, or extracurricular work demonstrating interest in UX/UI and communication design.
  • Area of Specialization: Design, User Experience Design or Product Design.

Eligibility Requirements

  • Must successfully pass a drug screen and background check prior to assignment target start date.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
  • Once your application is submitted, you will be prompted to complete our immersive GSK Digital Assessment. A passing score is required to proceed in the application process. After completing the assessment, a recruiter will review your application and contact you with next steps.
    • Please note: If you do not receive an automated email after submitting your application, be sure to check your spam folder.

Benefits

  • Mentorship from senior UX, UI, Research, and Product professionals.
  • Hands‚Äëon experience designing for enterprise digital products in the AI and data space.
  • Exposure to Design Thinking, Agile delivery, and modern design systems.
  • Opportunities to grow a portfolio with industry‚Äërelevant, real‚Äëworld work.
  • A collaborative, supportive environment that encourages learning, experimentation, and career development.
  • While GSK embraces a flexible work environment, we do require certain positions to be onsite. Candidates who are hired for an on-site role or hybrid role, and reside outside of 50-miles from their assigned work location, are eligible for relocation stipend. This is a one-time payment to help offset housing & relocation expenses. Please refer to the position details for the requirements of each position.
  • GSK Interns and Co-ops are offered a competitive hourly pay rate and benefits. Please note, benefits eligibility determined the month following date of hire.

  • This job posting is for a temporary role as an employee of Atrium on assignment at GSK. The individual selected for this role will be offered the role as an employee of Atrium; compensation, medical benefits, fringe benefits and other terms and conditions of employment shall be presented by Atrium upon offer. The pay rate range provided is a reasonable estimate of the anticipated compensation range for this job at the time of posting. The actual pay rate will be based on several factors, including skills, competencies, experience, educational degree obtained, location and/or being pursued and other job-related factors permitted by law.

    In addition, this role will be eligible for overtime pay, in accordance with federal and state requirement.

    • Pay Rate Range: $22/hr to $43/hr

Interested in learning more? Register now on our digital learning platform (GSK Get Ahead - Connectr) where you can access interview and assessment hints and tips, speak to a mentor and learn more about life at GSK.
